title: i just ran a tracert because i am getting 200 ping and above.

replies.body:
Similar problem here. Pretty similar trace, too. Everything's good until hop 12 at Riot servers where it's at 200+ ms.

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

I put plus signs where there were asterisks because the boards removed them thinking they were intended for formatting.
where are you, geographically speaking? i am in Nebraska.
Iowa.

what part of iowa? i am in iowa atm in college and my ping was fine until about 2 days ago. i can play wow and bf1 and other agmes with about 30-50 ping when i get into a league game my ping goes to 200+

I too live near the university so i dont know if you mean UNI or UOI. It also started aroudn saturday for me aswell

yeah idk whats going on this some bs though. it would be nice to get an official response on whats going on but i dont think that will happen. so i hope they get this fixed soon so we can play but i guess we will see on how fast riot works.
I too am getting a steady ping of 200 from Iowa. Ran a speed test for 10 ping 72.2 down, and 1.2 up

its a midwest problem maybe? i think we are going through the same hubs!
@riot a response would be nice

Iowa player going through the same thing, started a few days ago

10   25ms 24ms 24ms 206.51.46.6
11   27ms 30ms 25ms 104.160.138.35
12   250ms   -          -      ae34-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net {104.160.159.22}
when did it start? mine started on Saturday
I couldn't play on sat, but it was there on Sunday and hasn't changed since then

Hmm.. it seems everyone's traces in this discussion has mostly been showing some basic trace data, but there's some other data we want to take a look at. I'd like you to run another trace using a networking app called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). You can use **104.160.131.1** for the host address then start the trace. After 5+ minutes has gone by, you can export the trace results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

If you run into any issues running your trace, reach back out.

I swear, this is the last time I'll bug you about it (I'll start a support ticket if things change), but I just wanted to chime in and say that things are looking normal again and here's one more set of data as proof:  From 11:28 to 11:31 CST

http://imgur.com/a/TkxRG

Thanks for all your help/hard work with this Targon <3

Yup, your trace shows thing look A-Okay now, no bursts of packet loss or hikes in latency show up.

If the issue comes back, don't hesitate to hit me up again.

here's some updated info for 10:41 to 10:45 CST:

http://imgur.com/a/TmrJg

I don't want to jump to any conclusions, but it's starting to seem like a network congestion issue as during prime gaming hours I get increased latency?  Just my "non networking profesional" thoughts :p

You know, that's actually not that uncommon of an occurrence. Some ISPs frequently reroute traffic during peak network hours to mitigate congestion on their networks. It looks like your latency starts spiking right outside your home network, which suggests this node (second line) is encountering issues during peak hours. If you reach out to a tier 2 agent or supervisor at your ISP with this traceroute, they should be able to launch an investigation based on this data.

I hope this helps. If you need any other help, just let me know! ^.^

indeed, I live right next to a small college in a small town, too.  maybe all the college students are doing some netflix n chill right when i want to game :p.  I know a few people that work at the ISP in town, I'll hit them up and see what they think.  Thanks again for the response and hard work.

Hey Targon, issue is back as of about 6:30 CST.  Here's the winMTR info:

http://imgur.com/a/qAD48

Data is from 7:20-7:25 CST
Your trace results show that your trace looks pretty normal now. If you run into further issues with this again, just let me know~ ^.^

It looks like your jumps in latency start at the first hop outside of your network at **100.73.0.2** where your latency spikes to **131ms** and then later your connection spikes again up to **110ms**. In this case, it looks like a few different nodes may be causing your increased latency and reaching out to a tier 2 agent at your ISP's technical support would be my suggested course of action. Providing these traceroute results and explaining the issue you're seeing in-game should be enough to launch an investigation.

If you have any other concerns, please let me know!

Thank you sir.
i did reach out to my isp.
I told them that i noticed the increased ping times (not ul/dl btw) mostly during peak usage times and asked them if they could look into their routing of traffic.
I told them that ul/dl were not affected and that with my old isp, even though i only had only 30/5, the ping to chicago was a constant 50.
I also asked them to contact you to talk about the peering agreement you guys have with other major ISP's in the country and showed them your website and reports about that.

They must have changed something because i have not had problems lately and my ping now is actually in the constant lower 30's

first Targons Blade, thank you for looking into this.

I am actually back to 32 ping, which is funny because my lowest so far was 50. 
I'll run the tracert you suggested and will post the results later.

I have contacted my ISP and asked them to contact you guys for a peering agreement.
I explained to them that Riot has been partnering with most major ISP's in the country and they promised to look into it!
I hope they do.
this is the normal dl/ul i get to my isp's server: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5998158917

I hope i can stay at 32 ping. its a different game at that latency!

Update:  latency is till bouncing around during games:  Here's a fresh set of data from WinMTR: 
http://imgur.com/a/5rymN

Thx for responding, much appreciated.  While i was tracing and running WinMTR the issue seemed to go away.  Here's my results regardless and I'll update if anything changes.

[(http://imgur.com/a/RC6lt)]

sorry, have not posted a link here before, let me know if you can't access the picture, thx
